Evaluation_Questions: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken
What is your overall assessment of this course
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor
The primary instructor's provided students with helpful and timely feedback
The instructor established a positive learning environment
The instructor raised questions or problems that encouraged me to think critically
Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved
Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
How would you summarize this course for a fellow student?  Would you recommend it to another student?  Why or why not
Comments_List:
The certifications were helpful and the in-class discussions were informative.
I expected to gain more practical experience in the field of emergency management by engaging with some real-world emergency situations.
Some of the instructions/expectations aren't clear
Was a good overview of all the topics pertinent to disaster preparedness. I really enjoyed the hands-on class activities, it would be great if more could be incorporated into the course.
This course was fantastic! I honestly can't think of something to improve. This was my favorite class I've taken at YSPH and at Yale in general.

Great course specific to the topic and training. Both instructors personal experience were a valuable part of the conversation and strengthened the course. Appreciated that the instructors left space for students to hold their own opinions and bring their experience.

This course provided a solid foundation in ICS and disaster preparedness and response systems through a public health lens. The instructors and guest speakers and their personal experiences in the field were the highlights of the course.

Strengths: very interesting topic and real world applications

Weaknesses: only meets once a week for a couple hours
The expectations of the instructors were not always clear but the examples from the instructors' experiences were engaging.
Incredibly knowledgeable, effective lecturer
An inspiration. Could not ask for a better instructor.
Strength - experience in the field.
Professor McGovern's experience and generosity towards her students made this class a really valuable professional experience.
Very knowledgeable, enthusiastic instructor who pairs real world experience with academic development.
The in-class discussions were very engaging and informative.
Incredibly knowledgeable, effective lecturer
10/10 Fantastic
Strength - experience in the field.
Professor Bogucki's extensive experience brought depth to the course, and her humor and candor made the class approachable.
Very knowledgeable, down to earth, insightful instructor who helps grow individual student interests.
The course expectations were not very clear, but the classes were interesting.
Good course summarizing the basics of disaster and emergency planning and response, with an emphasis on the practical. Yes I would recommend it.
If you have any interest in emergency response, outbreaks, or even just want to take a fun class I couldn't recommend this course more!

Comprehensive training specific to governmental response and provides knowledge and dialogue to be best be prepared to support and respond as an individual working in the field. Would recommend this course to anyone interested in the topic.

I would summarize this course as one of the few courses relevant to this very important subset within public health. I would recommend it to anyone interested in emergency services or disaster planning.
The perfect course for a student looking for policy knowledge and experience in the realm of public health emergencies.
